definition[0]: to do or deal with something at a later time
example[0]: The matter was held over for further review.
explanation[0]: Hold over is usually passive in this meaning
definition[1]: to use something bad that you know about someone to make them do what you want
example[1]: He knows Iâ€™ve been in prison and is holding it over me.
definition[2]: if a play, film, concert etc is held over, it is shown for longer than planned because it is very popular
